rules: Rule1: Whenever the artwork is curated, the furniture being assembled ensures that it is installed.
Rule2: Either the artwork is curated or it is restored.
Rule3: If the artwork is restored, then the assembly of the furniture leads to its installation.
Rule4: The legislation is funded, or the vehicle is sponsored.
Rule5: Should the vehicle be sponsored, the gallery becomes open.
Rule6: Given that the artwork is reviewed, funding of the legislation results in the gallery opening.
Rule7: Assuming the artwork is selected, the gallery opening follows from the legislation being funded.
Rule8: When the artwork is framed, and it is neither reviewed nor selected, then it is exhibited.
Rule9: Either the artwork is framed or it is lit.
Rule10: Lighting the artwork implies that it is mounted.
Rule11: If the artwork is lit, then it is spotlighted.
Rule12: Securing the vehicle leads to it being parked.
Rule13: Either the vehicle is secured, or if lighting the artwork does not ensure that lack of review or selection leads to exhibition, then the artwork is positioned.
Rule14: Enacting the legislation means it is not amended.
Rule15: Hiring the job results in it being trained.
Rule16: Should the job be trained, then if the legislation is not permitted or the gallery is not open, the legislation is enacted.
Rule17: The furniture is delayed, or the gallery is open.
Rule18: Whenever the job is available, the furniture being repaired means it is not delayed.
Rule19: Either the vehicle is assigned or it is maintained.
Rule20: Maintaining the vehicle means the job is not canceled.
Rule21: Inspecting the vehicle results in it not being secured.
Rule22: Cleaning the vehicle leads to it being inspected.
Rule23: Taxing the vehicle implies it is licensed.
Rule24: If the vehicle is taxed, then it is not documented.
Rule25: Certifying the vehicle implies it is documented.
Rule26: Exempting the vehicle means it is not impounded.
Rule27: Hanging the artwork, and if it is not reviewed or not selected, results in it being exhibited.
Rule28: Signing the legislation, and if mounting the artwork does not lead to it being hung, then the artwork is stored.

Rule29: Submitting the artwork means either the legislation is approved, or if not having the gallery open implies the furniture is damaged, then the vehicle being insured leads to the job being scheduled.
Rule30: Debating the legislation implies it is not passed.
Rule31: Either the legislation is implemented, or if debating the legislation does not lead to it being passed, then it is vetoed.
Rule32: Either the artwork is cataloged, or spotlighting the artwork ensures that lack of review or selection leads to exhibition.
Rule33: Publishing the artwork implies it is either photographed or not cataloged.
Rule34: The artwork is published, or it is promoted.
Rule35: Promoting the artwork means it is either photographed or not cataloged.
Rule36: Polishing the furniture ensures that repairing it means it is not delayed.
Rule37: Either the furniture is polished or it is varnished.
Rule38: Protecting the furniture means that repairing it ensures it is not delayed.
Rule39: Scheduling the job implies it is available.
Rule40: Either the job is scheduled or it is performed.
Rule41: Paying the job ensures that performing it leads to availability.
Rule42: Supervising the job means it is evaluated.
Rule43: Either the job is supervised or it is completed.
Rule44: Completing the job implies it is paid.
Rule45: Evaluating the job means it is paid.
Rule46: Packing the furniture means that if the gallery is not open, then the artwork is not displayed.
Rule47: Either the furniture is packed or the vehicle is transported.
Rule48: Unpacking the furniture implies it is delivered.
Rule49: The furniture is unpacked, or it is arranged.
Rule50: Arranging the furniture means it is not delayed.
Rule51: Finishing the job means it is started.
Rule52: Documenting the job, and if not assigning the job implies it is not canceled, then finishing the job leads to it being reviewed.
Rule53: Reporting the job means that if not assigning the job implies it is not canceled, then finishing the job leads to review.
Rule54: Transporting the vehicle means the job is completed.
Rule55: Should the artwork not be reviewed or not selected, then it is not exhibited.
Rule56: Provided the legislation is not permitted or the gallery is not open, then the legislation is amended.
Rule57: If assigning the vehicle does not imply the job is not canceled, then the vehicle is replaced.
Rule58: Should registering the vehicle not imply it is not secured, then the vehicle is taxed.
Rule59: If mounting the artwork does not imply it is hung, then the artwork is not stored.
Rule60: In case varnishing the furniture does not ensure it is protected, then the furniture is damaged.
Rule61: If varnishing the furniture does not imply it is protected, then the furniture is not damaged.
Rule62: Should assigning the job not lead to it not being canceled, then the job is not started.
Rule63: If the job is neither documented nor reported, then it is extended.
Rule64: If completing the job does not imply that lack of gallery opening leads to artwork not being displayed, then the furniture is assembled.
Rule65: Should completing the job not lead to the condition that gallery not open implies artwork not displayed, then the furniture is not installed.
Rule66: If not licensing the vehicle implying it is certified does not lead to it being fined, then the vehicle is impounded.
Rule67: If not assigning the job meaning it is not canceled does not imply it is finished, then the job is not reviewed.
Rule68: If not having the gallery open meaning the furniture is damaged does not imply the vehicle is insured, then the job is not scheduled.
Rule69: If not having the gallery open implies the furniture is damaged, then the vehicle is not insured.
Rule70: The job not being available means it is canceled.
Rule71: The legislation not being signed implies it is debated.
Rule72: Should the gallery not be open, then the artwork is displayed.
Rule73: If the gallery is not open, then the furniture is not damaged.
facts: Fact8: The artwork is not positioned.
Fact9: The vehicle is not parked.
Fact10: The legislation is not permitted.
Fact11: The vehicle is not replaced.
Fact12: The legislation is not approved.
Fact13: The vehicle is not fined.
Fact14: The legislation is not vetoed.
Fact15: The legislation is not implemented.
Fact16: The artwork is not photographed.
Fact17: The furniture is not delivered.
Fact18: The job is not extended.
